Class Game

java.lang.Object
jpacman.model.Game
public class Game extends Object
Representation of the board and its guests. This class's responsibilities include the correct movement of moving guests, and keeping track of the state of the game (whether the player died, or whether everything has been eaten, for example)

Version:
$Id: Game.java,v 1.10 2008/02/10 20:46:01 arie Exp $
Author:
Arie van Deursen; Aug 24, 2003

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game()
      Create a new Game using a default map.

    • Game

      public Game(String[] map)
      Create a new Game using a custom map.
      Parameters:
      map - The world to be used in the game.

  • Method Details

    • initialized

      public boolean initialized()
      Check whether all relevant fields have been initialized.
      Returns:
      true iff initialization has completed successfully.

    • consistent

      public boolean consistent()
      The game should always be in a consistent state, in particular, a player cannot win and die at the same time.
      Returns:
      True iff the above holds.

    • invariant

      public boolean invariant()
      A game is either not yet initialized, or it is in a consistent state.
      Returns:
      True iff this is the case.

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Get the board of this game, which can be null if the game has not been initialized.
      Returns:
      The game's board.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Return the current player, which can be null if the game has not yet been initialized.
      Returns:
      the player of the game.

    • getMonsters

      public Vector<Monster> getMonsters()
      Return a fresh Vector containing all the monsters in the game.
      Returns:
      All the monsters.

    • playerDied

      public boolean playerDied()
      Check if the player has died. Precondition: initialization completed.
      Returns:
      True iff the player is dead.

    • playerWon

      public boolean playerWon()
      Check if the player has eaten all food. Precondition: initialization completed.
      Returns:
      True iff the player has won.

    • gameOver

      public boolean gameOver()
      Check whether the game is over.
      Returns:
      True iff the game is over.

    • getPlayerLastDx

      public int getPlayerLastDx()
      Return the delta in the x-direction of the last (attempted or succesful) player move. Returns 0 if player hasn't moved yet.
      Returns:
      delta in x direction

    • getPlayerLastDy

      public int getPlayerLastDy()
      Return the delta in the y-direction of the last (attempted or succesful) player move. Returns 0 if player hasn't moved yet.
      Returns:
      delta in y direction

    • boardWidth

      public int boardWidth()
      Return the width of the Board used.
      Returns:
      width of the board.

    • boardHeight

      public int boardHeight()
      Return the height of the Board used.
      Returns:
      height of the board.

    • getGuestCode

      public char getGuestCode(int x, int y)
      Return the guest code at position (x,y).
      Parameters:
      x - x-coordinate of guest
      y - y-coordinate of guest
      Returns:
      Character representing guest at x,y
